thread.title: Kiefer Sutherland tweets support for 24: Legacy
thread.title_full: Kiefer Sutherland tweets support for 24: Legacy

author: Ruth Kinane
title: Kiefer Sutherland tweets support for 24: Legacy
text:
Email 
Fox’s new show 24: Legacy is airing in the post-Super Bowl slot, and Kiefer Sutherland, for one, will be tuning in. 
The reboot of the real-time thriller 24 , which starred Sutherland as counter-terrorism agent Jack Bauer, follows war hero Eric Carter (Corey Hawkins) as he is hunted as part of a vengeance scheme that unfolds over the course of one long day. Miranda Otto ( Homeland ) also stars as Rebecca Ingram, the head of a revived Counter Terrorist Unit. 
Before the new show aired Sunday night, Sutherland tweeted his support for the series. “To the cast and crew of @24fox,” he wrote, “break a leg tonight.” To the cast and crew of @24fox break a leg tonight. 
— Kiefer Sutherland (@RealKiefer) February 6, 2017 
The premiere episode of 24: Legacy will serve as the lead-out program for Super Bowl LI before moving to its regular time slot of 8 p.m. ET on Mondays. Show Full Article
